column4: my ubuntu live cd does not recognize the existing partition table
have you tried using testdisk? might need to recover your partitions
is it available in the live cd
it is not found there, no, but you can find the binary here: http://www.cgsecurity.org/wiki/TestDisk
it needs to be run from terminal
not sure what you mean by hirens
it works fine on my 32 bit ubuntu install, did you try it out?
the thing is already formatted my previous ubuntu partition and now i cannot boot into an operating system, and tried to run the testdisk from the ubuntu live cd
so you are trying to recover your data?
i am trying to install a newer ubuntu
on the formatted previous ubuntu partion
gotcha, so the issue you are having is ubuntu is not seeing that partition. is that correct?
but i do not want to lose the windows partition and the data partition which are there but the ubuntu live cd does not see them
so you didn't touch the windows partition when you formatted, correct? if so, testdisk should be able to detect the Windows OS on there
